thread.title: Berlin calls on Volkswagen to regain trust
thread.title_full: Berlin calls on Volkswagen to regain trust | Business Spectator

author: Dow Jones newswires
title: Berlin calls on Volkswagen to regain trust
text:
The German transport minister on Wednesday called on Volkswagen AG to help clarify its position over accusations from the US Environmental Protection Agency that the auto maker has deliberately flouted air-pollution rules on cars sold since 2008.
"There is now doubt, trust has to be regained," Alexander Dobrindt told reporters after a meeting of the lower house of parliament's transport committee. "This is a task for VW."
Mr Dobrindt evaded a reporter's question on whether Volkswagen's Chief Executive Martin Winterkornn is suited to help clarify the matter.
A spokeswoman for the German economics ministry declined to comment on speculation about Volkswagen's personnel situation.
"The acting head of a big company is always a point of contact for the German government," said spokeswoman Tanja Alemany Sanchez de León.
Volkswagen's board is meeting Wednesday to discuss the emissions scandal.
On Tuesday, Volkswagen admitted to misconduct and said it would take a €6.5 billion ($US7.3 billion) charge on earnings. It said as many as 11 million vehicles worldwide could be affected.
